name: Tikka
short_description: Juicy, boneless chicken is marinated in tangy yogurt and a blend of aromatic spices like turmeric and cumin, then grilled to perfection. A beloved Pakistani street food staple bursting with flavor!

name: Chaat
short_description: Originating from the vibrant streets of Pakistan, chaat tantalizes with its medley of salty, spicy, sweet, and sour flavors. Each bite features crispy textures, fresh herbs, and zesty sauces, creating an irresistible snack experience.

name: Seekh kabab
short_description: Juicy, spiced lamb is skewered and grilled to perfection in seekh kabab, a beloved Pakistani street food. Infused with garlic, ginger, and coriander, each bite bursts with flavor and tradition.

name: Chicken karahi (Murgh karahi)
short_description: A beloved dish from Pakistan, Chicken karahi features tender chicken simmered in a spicy blend of red chili powder, cumin, and garam masala, all cooked to perfection in a traditional wok-like pot.

name: Korma
short_description: A royal delight from Mughlai cuisine, Korma features tender meat braised in a fragrant blend of spices, yogurt, and nuts, creating a rich, velvety sauce that tantalizes the taste buds.

name: Paratha
short_description: Golden-brown and flaky, paratha hails from Pakistan and is a beloved breakfast staple. Its layered texture and buttery richness make each bite irresistibly delicious, often enjoyed with savory curries or yogurt.

name: Chapli kabab
short_description: Originating from Pashtun cuisine, these spicy minced meat patties blend beef or mutton with fragrant dried coriander and zesty Tlaola Serrano chilies, delivering a flavorful punch in every bite.

name: Nihari
short_description: Originating from Old Delhi, Nihari features tender slow-cooked beef shank, mutton, or chicken simmered in rich ghee and aromatic spices. A beloved comfort food, it's often enjoyed with naan at breakfast.

name: Keema
short_description: A beloved Pakistani dish, this hearty stew blends ground mutton and chicken with vibrant green peas, tangy tomatoes, and aromatic spices. Slow-cooked to perfection, it bursts with flavor and warmth.

name: Chicken tikka (Murgh tikka)
short_description: Succulent pieces of marinated chicken are grilled to perfection in this beloved Pakistani dish, bursting with the bold flavors of red chili, ginger, and cumin. A must-try for spice lovers!

name: Samosa
short_description: Crispy and golden, these triangular pastries embrace a savory filling of spiced potatoes and peas. Originating from the Indian subcontinent, samosas offer a delightful crunch that captures the essence of Pakistani street food.

name: Zeera chawal
short_description: Fragrant basmati rice dances with nutty cumin seeds saut√©ed in ghee, offering a warm, aromatic delight. A staple in Pakistani cuisine, zeera chawal is often garnished with fresh mint and a hint of spice.

name: Zarda
short_description: Vibrant yellow zarda, a cherished Pakistani dessert, features aromatic basmati rice simmered in sweetened milk and infused with natural colors. Its delightful blend of cardamom and saffron elevates every bite.

name: Sajji
short_description: Originating from Balochistan, tender lamb is marinated in salt and spices, then skewered and slow-roasted to perfection. Each bite bursts with smoky flavor, embodying the rich culinary heritage of Pakistan.

name: Bihari kebab
short_description: Originating from Bihar, these tender beef kebabs are marinated in a rich blend of mustard oil, dahi, and aromatic spices, including nutmeg and garam masala. Grilled to perfection, they offer a burst of flavors that celebrate South Asian culinary tradition.

name: Roshmalai
short_description: Delicately spiced with cardamom and enriched with saffron, this creamy dessert features soft paneer cheese soaked in sweetened milk. A beloved treat in Pakistan, it's garnished with crunchy almonds for a delightful finish.

name: Peshwari naan
short_description: Originating from Peshawar, Peshwari naan delights with its soft, fluffy texture and a sweet filling of pistachios, almonds, and coconut, all enhanced by a rich brush of ghee.

name: Sindhi biryani
short_description: Originating from Sindh, this vibrant biryani layers fragrant basmati rice with tender lamb and chicken, enhanced by juicy tomatoes and sweet prunes, creating a symphony of flavors in every bite.

name: Chapati
short_description: Unleavened and hearty, chapati features whole wheat flour and a touch of ghee, baked to perfection on a griddle. A staple in Pakistani cuisine, it pairs beautifully with curries and vegetables.

name: Halwa poori
short_description: Delight in the rich flavors of Pakistan with halwa poori, where golden semolina pudding meets soft, flaky fried dough. A beloved breakfast that promises warmth and sweetness in every bite.

name: Papad
short_description: Crisp and savory, these Pakistani papads are made from a blend of rice, chickpea, and gram flour, infused with cumin and asafoetida. Perfectly baked, they elevate any meal or snack time with their delightful crunch.

name: Gol Gappa
short_description: Crispy, hollow puris filled with spiced potatoes, chickpeas, and tangy tamarind water create an explosion of flavors in this beloved Pakistani street snack. A must-try for adventurous palates!

name: Aloo gosht
short_description: Originating from Pakistan, this hearty stew combines tender lamb, beef, or mutton with soft potatoes, simmered in a rich tomato sauce. Spices infuse every bite, offering a comforting and flavorful experience.

name: Haleem
short_description: A beloved Ramadan staple, this hearty porridge blends slow-cooked meat, wheat, and a fragrant mix of spices. Each spoonful offers a rich, savory flavor, steeped in centuries of tradition.
